title: Darrell Nulisch
text:
Darrell Nulisch (born September 14, 1952, <a href="Dallas%2C%20Texas">Dallas, Texas</a>) is an American <a href="electric%20blues">electric blues</a> <a href="singing">singer</a> and <a href="harmonica">harmonica</a> player. Prior to his <a href="solo%20%28music%29">solo</a> career, he was a member of <a href="Anson%20Funderburgh">Anson Funderburgh and the Rockets</a> and <a href="Ronnie%20Earl">The Broadcasters</a>. Nulisch's repertoire incorporates <a href="soul%20music">soul</a> combined with <a href="Rhythm%20and%20blues">R&B</a> and <a href="Chicago%20blues">Chicago blues</a>, redesigned to complement his distinctive <a href="human%20voice">vocals</a>.
Biography.
Nulisch was raised listening to <a href="Otis%20Redding">Otis Redding</a> and <a href="Al%20Green">Al Green</a>. In 1981 he was a founding member of <a href="Anson%20Funderburgh">Anson Funderburgh</a>'s Rockets and sang with them until 1985. He was then part of <a href="Mike%20Morgan%20%28blues%20musician%29">Mike Morgan's Crawl</a>, before moving to <a href="Massachusetts">Massachusetts</a> and joining up with <a href="Ronnie%20Earl">Ronnie Earl</a>'s Broadcasters in 1988.
He began his solo career late in 1990, relocating to <a href="Boston">Boston</a>. <a href="James%20Cotton">James Cotton</a> then asked him to sing with Cotton's band on tour, after Cotton had lost his own <a href="human%20voice">voice</a>. Nulisch appeared on <a href="Otis%20Grand">Otis Grand</a>'s 1996 album, "Perfume and Grime", which also utilized <a href="Luther%20Allison">Luther Allison</a>.
Several of the songs in Nulisch's repertoire are his own, most of them written with Steve Gomes, who plays <a href="bass%20guitar">bass guitar</a> in Texas Heat, the band that backed Nulisch for a number of years. Other band members included Benjie Porecki (<a href="piano">piano</a>), <a href="Johnny%20Moeller">Johnny Moeller</a> (guitar) and Robb Stupka (<a href="drum">drum</a>s).
Nulisch issued "I Like It That Way" in 2000. His <a href="fan%20%28person%29">fan</a> base started to expand from this point. His latest release, "Just for You", was released in October 2009. It received a four star rating from <a href="Allmusic">Allmusic</a>.
